nodes.text: The neuronic whip was a particularly cruel creation of TholCorp, the purpose of which was to send powerful electrical charges into a being's nerve cells, causing a great deal of pain and trauma.

It was a long, flexible cable, connected to a power pack in a handle that delivered a stunning jolt on contact. Unlike a typical leather whip, the heavy cable could crack bones and break flesh, although death was an extremely unlikely outcome.

Neuronic whips were very popular amongst slavers. The Mytaranor Slaving Council used them extensively after their leader Talas Piran found a cache of them in a hidden compartment of the recently acquired ship the Vanquisher. Imperial Dungeoneers also used neuronic whips.
Neuronic whips were originally used extensively in the Foundation and Empire series, two series of science-fiction novels written by Isaac Asimov from which many Star Wars concepts were taken.
